oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Interview and performance - Kinky Freidman - 2018-06-03
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Interview by and performance with Kinky Freidman from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on June 3, 2018. Hosted by Peter Cooper. Presented in support of the exhibit Outlaws & Armadillos: Country’s Roaring ʼ70s.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Kinky Freidman;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in Music / (09:04) Opening comments and introduction by Peter Cooper / (12:09) Opening comments / (12:23) Kinky talks about his given name and some of his times at Glaser Sound Studio / (14:25) Talk about his hearing problems / (16:24) Talk about the song Ride 'Em Jewboy / (19:02) Performs Ride 'Em Jewboy / (23:39) Talks about his Man In Black Tequila / (24:10) Introduces the next song / (24:46) Sings the theme song from the television show Have Gun, Will Travel / (26:22) Talks about writing and recording the song Ride 'Em Jewboy / (28:05) Talk about country music, when he became aware of it, writing Ride 'Em Jewboy and getting a tattoo in Borneo while in the Peace Corps / (30:53) Asked about his time in Austin, Texas, then talks about Willie Nelson and Davy Crockett leaving Tennessee and going to Texas / (32:27) Talks about Van Gogh, Mozart and compares the Nashville record business to the people who yelled free Barabbas, kill Jesus / (34:29) Mentions Tompall Glaser, Hazel Smith and Captain Midnight / (36:00) Talks about and reads an excerpt from his book Heroes Of A Texas Childhood / (45:32) Talks about language, why he writes, the novel Desert Rose and writing between the lines / (48:38) Talk about the song Sold American, Donald Trump and Jesus / (51:47) Plays video of performance of Sold American by Willie Nelson and Kinky Freidman / (53:27) Talk about the previous video clip / (53:48) Talk about Willie Nelson, running for Governor of Texas and writing books / (56:13) Talks about Willie Nelson encouraging him to start writing songs again / (01:00:40) Kinky talks about the next song / (01:01:32) Performs Jesus In Pajamas / (01:05:25) Performs Autographs In The Rain (Song To Willie) / (01:10:01) Closing comments / 01:19:24) Walk-out Music / (01:11:16) FILE END
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:format: original source recorded as an mp3 file at 44.1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Freidman, Kinky; Freidman, Richard; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
